chapter.title: Property Access Methods (get and set Methods)
chapter.para: Sometimes you may want to have access operations for some properties of classes. GeneSEZ provides support of the generation of property access operations.

section.title: Specification in UML Models
section.para: You have the following possibilities to issue the generation of property access operations:

listitem.para: use of any stereotype on UML classes or data types to add a get and set operation for each attribute

use the stereotype
accessor of the GeneSEZ profile to issue and control the generation of get and set methods in detail

section.para: Using the first approach you can easily use your own already assigned stereotypes. With the second approach you can adjust the generation to suit your needs.

section.title: Configuration of the Model to Text Transformation in Workflow
section.para: All Generator workflow components provide the same parameters to configure the generation of property access operations:

listitem.para: Allows to specify a comma separated list with names of stereotypes. For all UML classifiers annotated with one of these stereotypes the generation of get and set operations for all attributes is issued.
Specifies the name of the accessor stereotype.
Specifies that the visibility of attributes should be always private and the visibility of the attribute is used as the visibility of property access operations.

section.title: Evaluation Process
section.para: The evaluation process wheter a property access operation is eventually generated or not is illustrated in figure using an UML activity diagram. It is executed for each attribute.

figure.title: Evaluation process of the different modeling possibilities

section.para: First it checks if the configured stereotype is assigned to the attribute and if it's tagged values are used to determine the generation. If not the class is checked if the configured stereotype is assigned to it and if it's tagged values are evaluated. Then it is checked if the class has one of the specified stereotypes assigned. If not the default is used to suppress the generation of property access operations.
If you wish you can combine the modeling possibilities as there is a fallback: local configuration, class wide configuration, model wide configuration.
The boolean values of the stereotype tags indicate the generation of property access operations.
